citation.article-title: Pedobacter lentus sp. nov. and Pedobacter terricola sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter lentus sp. nov.
Pedobacter lentus (len′tus. L. masc. adj. lentus slow, delayed, referring to the slow growth of the micro-organism).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, non-flagellated cocci, oval-shaped or rods (0.4–0.8×0.4–3.0 μm).
Colonies on NA are circular, convex, smooth, glistening, pale yellow to pale orange in colour and 0.3–0.5 mm in diameter after incubation for 7 days at 25 °C.
Optimal growth occurs at 25 °C; growth occurs at 4 and 31 °C, but not at 32 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 6.5–7.5; growth occurs at pH 6.0 and 8.0, but not at pH 5.5 or 8.5.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 0–1.0 % (w/v) NaCl; growth does not occur in the presence of more than 4 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth does not occur under anaerobic conditions on NA or on NA supplemented with nitrate.
Starch and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed, but casein, gelatin, tyrosine, hypoxanthine and xanthine are not.
Sensitive to carbenicillin, cephalothin, lincomycin, neomycin, polymyxin B and streptomycin, but not to novobiocin or oleandomycin.
Major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content is 36.0 mol% (HPLC).

The type strain, DS-40T (=KCTC 12875T=JCM 14593T), was isolated from soil from the island of Dokdo, Korea.
